1.t: When the heavens are rent asunder

2.t: in obedience to the commands of their Lord which are incumbent on them,

3.t: when the earth is stretched out

4.t: and throws out of itself all that it contains

5.t: in obedience to the commands of its Lord which are incumbent on it, (the human being will receive due recompense for his deeds).

6.t: Human being, you strive hard to get closer to your Lord, and so you will certainly receive the recompense (of your deeds).
6.tr: Yaaa-ayyuhal insaanu innaka kaadihun ilaa Rabbika kad-han famulaaqeeh

7.t: The reckoning of those whose Book of records will be given into their right hands

9.t: and they will return to their people, delighted

10.t: But as for those whose Book of records will be given behind their backs,
10.tr: Wa-ammaa man ootiya kitaabahoo waraaa'a zahrih

12.t: They will suffer the heat of hell fire.

13.t: They lived among their people joyfully

14.t: and had thought that they would never be brought back to life again.

15.t: This is a fact. Their Lord is Well-Aware of (all that they do).
15.tr: Balaaa inna Rabbahoo kaana bihee baseeraa

16.t: I do not need to swear by the sunset,

17.t: or by the night in which things all come together to rest,

18.t: or by the moon when it is full,

19.t: that you will certainly pass through one stage after another.

20.t: What is the matter with them? Why do they not believe?

21.t: Why, when the Quran is recited to them, do they not prostrate themselves?

22.t: In fact, they reject the Quran,

23.t: but God knows best whatever they accumulate in their hearts.

24.t: (Muhammad), tell them that they will all suffer a painful torment

25.t: except the righteously striving believers, who will receive a never-ending reward.
25.tr: Illal lazeena aamanoo Wa-'amilus saalihaati lahum ajrun ghairu mamnoon
